title: Paul McCartney Protests U.K. Government’s Approach to AI on 'Silent' Song
description: Paul McCartney has contributed a track to a new compilation LP protesting the U.K. government's recent law changes around artificial intelligence.
content:
Paul McCartney will contribute a ‘silent’ track to a compilation album that is protesting the U.K. government’s recent changes to copyright law.
The LP Is This What We Want? was first released digitally in February and was co-signed by over a thousan... [2613 chars]

title: Plotly Dash Enterprise Named Finalist for InfoWorld Technology of the Year
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 17, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Plotly, the leading provider of visual data applications and pioneer in the vibe analytics movement, today announced that Plotly Dash Enterprise has been named a finalist for the 2025 InfoWorld Technology of the Year Awards. These awards recognize the best and most innovative products in software development, cloud computing, data analytics, and artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML). Winners will be announced in a special InfoWorld edition in December.

title: GMI Cloud to build $500 million AI data centre in Taiwan with Nvidia chips
description: TAIPEI (Reuters) -U.S.-based cloud services provider GMI Cloud said on Monday it will build a $500 million artificial intelligence data centre in Taiwan with the support of U.S. chipmaker Nvidia.
content:
TAIPEI (Reuters) -U.S.-based cloud services provider GMI Cloud said on Monday it will build a $500 million artificial intelligence data centre in Taiwan with the support of U.S. chipmaker Nvidia.

title: GMI Cloud to build $500 million AI data centre in Taiwan with Nvidia chips
description: U.S.-based cloud services provider GMI Cloud said on Monday it will build a $500 million artificial intelligence data centre in Taiwan with the support of U.S. chipmaker Nvidia .
content: The data centre will come online by March 2026 and will run on Nvidia’s new Blackwell GB300 chips. The facility will house about 7,000 GPUs across 96 high-density racks, capable of processing nearly 2 million tokens per second. It will draw around 16... [1544 chars]

title: Anthropic CEO reveals 3 jobs for freshers that AI is going to kill in future
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has delivered one of the starkest assessments yet of how fast artificial intelligence could change the early-career job market. He reveals three jobs for freshers that AI is going to kill in future.
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has delivered one of the starkest assessments yet of how fast artificial intelligence could change the early-career job market. His warning is blunt that roles traditionally filled by freshers in consulting, law and finance... [3127 chars]

title: India's AI Governance Guidelines 2025: A Framework For Safe And Inclusive Innovation
description: Artificial Intelligence is reshaping how societies work, communicate, and govern. Recognising both its transformative potential and its inherent risks, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has released the India AI Governance Guidelines 2025. These guidelines aim to position India as a responsible global leader in the development and use of AI. They combine legal and technical safeguards with a strong focus on innovation, accountability and public trust.

title: The Case for AI Is (Finally) Showing Up in Earnings
description: The artificial-intelligence boom is raging, fueled by a mad dash to add computing capacity. Tech giants are funneling billions of dollars to construction companies and industrial suppliers of equipment and power to build the vast data centers that the technology requires.It feels frothy and ripe for a correction because of the hype about AI and the historical similarities to the dot-com bubble of the mid-1990s, which was propelled by unrealistic valuations and risky bets on flimsy business model

title: Love it or hate it, AI is changing polling for the better
description: Pollsters need to be fast enough to match the fluidity of ever-changing battle lines. Artificial intelligence-optimized surveys are the fix.
content:
Democrats aren’t the only ones celebrating after the 2025's elections. So are political pollsters.
Although the polling industry materially undercounted the backing for the winning candidates and causes, pollsters accurately foretold the outcomes.
